instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 No CPU Vcore
threads.message:
Hi all,

This is a liquid damaged Logic board.
Damaged the LCD connactor on LCD side. Fan spinging.
U7410 had liquid detect stickers gone red but no damage  can see physically.
I get PPVCCSA_CPU and PPVCORE_S0_GPU
Missing PPVCC_S0_CPU and PPVCCGT_S0_GPU.

All the other major rails are present. I replaced the U7410. 
Any Clue?

threads.title: 820-00928 No CPU Vcore
threads.message:
Probably damaged CPU, caused by liquid near its power supplies.
Could also be accumulated crap under some BGA chips, or just a simple corroded resistor/cap.

BTW, VCCGT refers to Intel graphics and do not expect it on boot.

threads.title: 820-00928 No CPU Vcore
threads.message: Hi Info, Thank you for quick reply. Noted I'll inspect more and get back to you. Thank you
